code:
// Kerala PSC Question Bank
const questionBank={'general-knowledge':{title:'General Knowledge',topics:[{id:1,topic:'Indian History',questions:[{id:1,question:'Who was the founder of the Mauryan Empire?',options:['Chandragupta Maurya','Ashoka','Bindusara','Samudragupta'],correct:0,explanation:'Chandragupta Maurya founded the Mauryan Empire in 321 BCE.'},{id:2,question:'The Battle of Plassey was fought in which year?',options:['1757','1764','1761','1756'],correct:0,explanation:'The Battle of Plassey was fought on 23 June 1757.'},{id:3,question:'Who was the first Governor-General of independent India?',options:['C. Rajagopalachari','Lord Mountbatten','Jawaharlal Nehru','Rajendra Prasad'],correct:1,explanation:'Lord Mountbatten was the first Governor-General of independent India.'},{id:4,question:'The Indian National Congress was founded in which year?',options:['1885','1905','1920','1942'],correct:0,explanation:'The Indian National Congress was founded in 1885.'},{id:5,question:'Who was the first woman President of the Indian National Congress?',options:['Sarojini Naidu','Annie Besant','Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit','Indira Gandhi'],correct:1,explanation:'Annie Besant was the first woman President of the Indian National Congress in 1917.'}]},{id:2,topic:'Kerala History',questions:[{id:6,question:'Who was known as the "Lion of Kerala"?',options:['Pazhassi Raja','Velu Thampi','Martanda Varma','Marthanda Varma'],correct:0,explanation:'Kerala Varma Pazhassi Raja was known as the "Lion of Kerala".'},{id:7,question:'The first hydroelectric project in Kerala was established at?',options:['Pallivasal','Sabarigiri','Idukki','Panniyar'],correct:0,explanation:'Pallivasal was the first hydroelectric project in Kerala, established in 1940.'},{id:8,question:'The Malayalam year "Kolla Varsham" began in?',options:['825 AD','1000 AD','1190 AD','1498 AD'],correct:0,explanation:'Kolla Varsham began in 825 AD.'},{id:9,question:'Who founded the "Samatwa Samajam" in 1907?',options:['Ayyankali','Vagbhatananda','Chattampi Swamikal','Thycaud Ayya'],correct:1,explanation:'Vagbhatananda founded the Samatwa Samajam in 1907.'},{id:10,question:'The first printing press in Kerala was established at?',options:['Cochin','Kottayam','Travancore','Tellicherry'],correct:2,explanation:'The first printing press in Kerala was established in Travancore in 1577.'}]},{id:3,topic:'Geography',questions:[{id:11,question:'Which is the longest river in Kerala?',options:['Periyar','Bharathapuzha','Pamba','Chaliyar'],correct:1,explanation:'Bharathapuzha (Nila) is the longest river in Kerala with a length of 209 km.'},{id:12,question:'The district in Kerala that does not border the sea is?',options:['Kottayam','Pathanamthitta','Palakkad','All of these'],correct:3,explanation:'Kottayam, Pathanamthitta and Palakkad are the districts without sea borders.'},{id:13,question:'Which pass connects Kerala with Tamil Nadu?',options:['Palakkad Gap','Aryankavu Pass','Perambadi Pass','All of these'],correct:3,explanation:'All these passes connect Kerala with Tamil Nadu.'},{id:14,question:'The southernmost district of Kerala is?',options:['Thiruvananthapuram','Kollam','Pathanamthitta','Alappuzha'],correct:0,explanation:'Thiruvananthapuram is the southernmost district of Kerala.'},{id:15,question:'The only district in Kerala that has no forest is?',options:['Alappuzha','Kollam','Thrissur','Ernakulam'],correct:0,explanation:'Alappuzha is the only district in Kerala without any forest area.'}]},{id:4,topic:'Indian Constitution',questions:[{id:16,question:'The concept of Fundamental Rights in the Indian Constitution has been borrowed from?',options:['USA','UK','France','Canada'],correct:0,explanation:'The concept of Fundamental Rights has been borrowed from the USA.'},{id:17,question:'How many schedules are there in the Indian Constitution?',options:['10','12','14','18'],correct:1,explanation:'There are 12 schedules in the Indian Constitution.'},{id:18,question:'The idea of Directive Principles of State Policy was borrowed from?',options:['Ireland','USA','UK','Canada'],correct:0,explanation:'Directive Principles of State Policy were borrowed from Ireland.'},{id:19,question:'Who was the chairman of the Drafting Committee of the Indian Constitution?',options:['B.R. Ambedkar','Jawaharlal Nehru','Rajendra Prasad','Sardar Patel'],correct:0,explanation:'Dr. B.R. Ambedkar was the chairman of the Drafting Committee.'},{id:20,question:'The Indian Constitution was adopted on?',options:['26 January 1950','26 November 1949','15 August 1947','26 January 1949'],correct:1,explanation:'The Constitution was adopted on 26 November 1949 and came into force on 26 January 1950.'}]},{id:5,topic:'Science and Technology',questions:[{id:21,question:'Which vitamin is also known as ascorbic acid?',options:['Vitamin A','Vitamin B','Vitamin C','Vitamin D'],correct:2,explanation:'Vitamin C is also known as ascorbic acid.'},{id:22,question:'The element common to all acids is?',options:['Hydrogen','Oxygen','Nitrogen','Sulphur'],correct:0,explanation:'All acids contain hydrogen.'},{id:23,question:'Which gland in the human body is called the master gland?',options:['Thyroid','Pituitary','Pancreas','Adrenal'],correct:1,explanation:'Pituitary gland is called the master gland as it controls other endocrine glands.'},{id:24,question:'The device used to measure atmospheric pressure is?',options:['Barometer','Hygrometer','Thermometer','Seismograph'],correct:0,explanation:'Barometer is used to measure atmospheric pressure.'},{id:25,question:'The fastest animal on earth is?',options:['Cheetah','Peregrine Falcon','Sailfish','Pronghorn Antelope'],correct:1,explanation:'Peregrine Falcon is the fastest animal when in a dive, reaching speeds over 320 km/h.'}]}]},'current-affairs':{title:'Current Affairs',topics:[{id:6,topic:'National Affairs',questions:[{id:26,question:'What is the capital of Telangana?',options:['Warangal','Hyderabad','Nizamabad','Karimnagar'],correct:1,explanation:'Hyderabad is the capital of Telangana state.'},{id:27,question:'The "Har Ghar Jal" initiative is associated with which ministry?',options:['Ministry of Jal Shakti','Ministry of Rural Development','Ministry of Health','Ministry of Agriculture'],correct:0,explanation:'Har Ghar Jal initiative is under the Ministry of Jal Shakti.'},{id:28,question:'Which state launched the "Subhadra Yojana" in 2024?',options:['Kerala','West Bengal','Odisha','Andhra Pradesh'],correct:2,explanation:'Odisha launched the Subhadra Yojana in 2024.'},{id:29,question:'The "PM-SURAJ" portal was launched for?',options:['Credit support to entrepreneurs','Solar energy initiatives','Sanitation workers','Agricultural subsidies'],correct:2,explanation:'PM-SURAJ portal was launched for sanitation workers of the country.'},{id:30,question:'Which state implemented the "Ladli Behna Yojana"?',options:['Madhya Pradesh','Uttar Pradesh','Rajasthan','Maharashtra'],correct:0,explanation:'Madhya Pradesh implemented the Ladli Behna Yojana.'}]},{id:7,topic:'International Affairs',questions:[{id:31,question:'Which country recently changed its name to "Bharat" officially?',options:['Nepal','India','Sri Lanka','None of these'],correct:3,explanation:'None of these countries have officially changed name to Bharat recently.'},{id:32,question:'The 2024 Summer Olympics will be held in?',options:['Paris','Los Angeles','Tokyo','London'],correct:0,explanation:'2024 Summer Olympics will be held in Paris, France.'},{id:33,question:'Which country recently joined BRICS in 2024?',options:['Egypt','Ethiopia','Iran','All of these'],correct:3,explanation:'Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran and others joined BRICS in 2024.'},{id:34,question:'The recent conflict between Israel and Palestine is centered around which area?',options:['West Bank','Gaza Strip','Golan Heights','Sinai Peninsula'],correct:1,explanation:'The recent conflict is centered around the Gaza Strip.'},{id:35,question:'Which country recently launched the "Chang\'e-6" lunar mission?',options:['USA','Russia','China','India'],correct:2,explanation:'China launched the Chang\'e-6 lunar mission in 2024.'}]},{id:8,topic:'Sports',questions:[{id:36,question:'Who won the FIFA World Cup 2022?',options:['France','Argentina','Brazil','Germany'],correct:1,explanation:'Argentina won the FIFA World Cup 2022.'},{id:37,question:'Which Indian athlete won gold in javelin throw at 2023 World Athletics Championships?',options:['Neeraj Chopra','Annu Rani','Shivpal Singh','Devendra Jhajharia'],correct:0,explanation:'Neeraj Chopra won gold in javelin throw at 2023 World Athletics Championships.'},{id:38,question:'The 2024 T20 Cricket World Cup was held in?',options:['India','Australia','West Indies and USA','South Africa'],correct:2,explanation:'2024 T20 World Cup was held in West Indies and USA.'},{id:39,question:'Who won the 2024 Australian Open Men\'s Singles title?',options:['Novak Djokovic','Jannik Sinner','Carlos Alcaraz','Daniil Medvedev'],correct:1,explanation:'Jannik Sinner won the 2024 Australian Open Men\'s Singles title.'},{id:40,question:'Which Indian state hosted the 2023 National Games?',options:['Goa','Kerala','Maharashtra','Gujarat'],correct:0,explanation:'Goa hosted the 2023 National Games.'}]},{id:9,topic:'Awards and Honors',questions:[{id:41,question:'Who won the 2023 Jnanpith Award?',options:['Sitanath Jha','Damodar Mauzo','Ramanik Singh','Gulzar'],correct:1,explanation:'Damodar Mauzo won the 2023 Jnanpith Award.'},{id:42,question:'Which Indian scientist recently won the International Gandhi Award?',options:['Dr. Ravi Kannan','Dr. Soumya Swaminathan','Dr. Gagandeep Kang','Dr. Tessy Thomas'],correct:0,explanation:'Dr. Ravi Kannan won the International Gandhi Award for 2023.'},{id:43,question:'Who was awarded the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize?',options:['Narges Mohammadi','Maria Ressa','Dmitry Muratov','Ales Bialiatski'],correct:0,explanation:'Narges Mohammadi won the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize.'},{id:44,question:'The 2023 Dadasaheb Phalke Award was given to?',options:['Waheeda Rehman','Asha Parekh','Hema Malini','Rekha'],correct:0,explanation:'Waheeda Rehman was awarded the 2023 Dadasaheb Phalke Award.'},{id:45,question:'Which Malayalam writer recently won the Ezhuthachan Puraskaram?',options:['M.T. Vasudevan Nair','Sethu','Kovilan','V.K.N.'],correct:1,explanation:'Sethu (A. Sethumadhavan) won the Ezhuthachan Puraskaram in 2023.'}]},{id:10,topic:'Kerala Current Affairs',questions:[{id:46,question:'Who is the current Chief Minister of Kerala (as of 2024)?',options:['Pinarayi Vijayan','V.D. Satheesan','K. Surendran','Ramesh Chennithala'],correct:0,explanation:'Pinarayi Vijayan is the current Chief Minister of Kerala.'},{id:47,question:'The "Life" mission in Kerala is related to?',options:['Healthcare','Housing','Education','Employment'],correct:1,explanation:'Life mission is related to housing for the homeless.'},{id:48,question:'Which district in Kerala was declared the first "Digital District"?',options:['Thiruvananthapuram','Ernakulam','Kozhikode','Kannur'],correct:3,explanation:'Kannur was declared the first "Digital District" in Kerala.'},{id:49,question:'The "Subiksha" project in Kerala is related to?',options:['Affordable medicine','Organic farming','Digital literacy','Women empowerment'],correct:0,explanation:'Subiksha project provides affordable medicine to the public.'},{id:50,question:'The "Pothuvidyabhyasa Samrakshana Yajnam" is an initiative for?',options:['Protecting public education','Digital education','Adult education','Technical education'],correct:0,explanation:'It is an initiative for protecting public education system in Kerala.'}]}]},'english':{title:'English',topics:[{id:11,topic:'Grammar',questions:[{id:51,question:'Choose the correct sentence:',options:['She don\'t like apples','She doesn\'t likes apples','She doesn\'t like apples','She not like apples'],correct:2,explanation:'The correct form is "She doesn\'t like apples" using third person singular.'},{id:52,question:'Identify the correctly spelled word:',options:['Occurrence','Occurence','Ocurrence','Occurrance'],correct:0,explanation:'The correct spelling is "Occurrence".'},{id:53,question:'Choose the correct preposition: "He is accused _______ theft."',options:['for','of','with','to'],correct:1,explanation:'The correct preposition is "of" - "accused of theft".'},{id:54,question:'Select the correct passive form: "They built this house in 1990."',options:['This house was built in 1990 by them.','This house is built in 1990 by them.','This house has been built in 1990 by them.','This house had been built in 1990 by them.'],correct:0,explanation:'The correct passive form is "This house was built in 1990 by them."'},{id:55,question:'Choose the correct question tag: "She can swim, ______?"',options:['can she','can\'t she','does she','doesn\'t she'],correct:1,explanation:'The correct question tag is "can\'t she" for positive statement.'}]},{id:12,topic:'Vocabulary',questions:[{id:56,question:'What is the synonym of "Benevolent"?',options:['Cruel','Kind','Stingy','Selfish'],correct:1,explanation:'Benevolent means well-meaning and kindly, so synonym is "Kind".'},{id:57,question:'What is the antonym of "Courageous"?',options:['Brave','Fearless','Timid','Bold'],correct:2,explanation:'Antonym of Courageous is Timid (lacking courage).'},{id:58,question:'The word "Ephemeral" means:',options:['Permanent','Lasting','Temporary','Eternal'],correct:2,explanation:'Ephemeral means lasting for a very short time (temporary).'},{id:59,question:'Choose the correct meaning of "Ambiguous":',options:['Clear','Unclear','Definite','Certain'],correct:1,explanation:'Ambiguous means open to more than one interpretation; unclear.'},{id:60,question:'What is the meaning of the idiom "Break the ice"?',options:['To cause trouble','To start a conversation','To end a relationship','To solve a problem'],correct:1,explanation:'"Break the ice" means to initiate conversation in a social setting.'}]},{id:13,topic:'Comprehension',questions:[{id:61,question:'Read the passage and answer: "The climate of Kerala is tropical...", What type of climate does Kerala have?',options:['Tropical','Temperate','Polar','Desert'],correct:0,explanation:'The passage states that Kerala has a tropical climate.'},{id:62,question:'Based on the passage: "The monsoon season in Kerala begins in June...", When does monsoon begin in Kerala?',options:['March','June','September','December'],correct:1,explanation:'The passage states monsoon begins in June.'},{id:63,question:'From the passage: "Kerala is known as God\'s Own Country...", What is Kerala known as?',options:['God\'s Own Country','Land of Kings','Pearl of the Orient','Spice Garden of India'],correct:0,explanation:'Kerala is known as "God\'s Own Country".'},{id:64,question:'According to the passage: "The literacy rate in Kerala is the highest in India...", Which state has the highest literacy rate?',options:['Kerala','Tamil Nadu','Maharashtra','Karnataka'],correct:0,explanation:'The passage states Kerala has the highest literacy rate.'},{id:65,question:'Based on the text: "The traditional dance form of Kerala is Kathakali...", What is the traditional dance form of Kerala?',options:['Bharatanatyam','Kathak','Kathakali','Mohiniyattam'],correct:2,explanation:'The passage states Kathakali is the traditional dance form.'}]},{id:14,topic:'Error Detection',questions:[{id:66,question:'Identify the error: "One of the students are absent today."',options:['One of the','students','are','absent today'],correct:2,explanation:'Error is "are" which should be "is" to agree with singular "one".'},{id:67,question:'Find the error: "She is more smarter than her brother."',options:['She is','more smarter','than','her brother'],correct:1,explanation:'Error is "more smarter" which should be "smarter" (comparative form).'},{id:68,question:'Spot the error: "I have been living in this city since five years."',options:['I have been','living in','this city','since five years'],correct:3,explanation:'Error is "since five years" which should be "for five years".'},{id:69,question:'Identify the error: "Neither of the boys have completed their homework."',options:['Neither of','the boys','have','their homework'],correct:2,explanation:'Error is "have" which should be "has" to agree with singular "neither".'},{id:70,question:'Find the error: "The teacher asked me that why I was late."',options:['The teacher','asked me','that why','I was late'],correct:2,explanation:'Error is "that why" which should be "why" (no need for "that").'}]},{id:15,topic:'Synonyms & Antonyms',questions:[{id:71,question:'What is the synonym of "Magnanimous"?',options:['Selfish','Generous','Stingy','Mean'],correct:1,explanation:'Magnanimous means very generous or forgiving, so synonym is Generous.'},{id:72,question:'What is the antonym of "Profound"?',options:['Deep','Shallow','Serious','Intense'],correct:1,explanation:'Antonym of Profound (deep, intense) is Shallow.'},{id:73,question:'The synonym of "Voracious" is:',options:['Small','Ravenous','Tiny','Little'],correct:1,explanation:'Voracious means wanting or devouring great quantities, so synonym is Ravenous.'},{id:74,question:'The antonym of "Benevolent" is:',options:['Kind','Cruel','Generous','Charitable'],correct:1,explanation:'Antonym of Benevolent (kind, well-meaning) is Cruel.'},{id:75,question:'What is the synonym of "Enigma"?',options:['Mystery','Solution','Answer','Clarity'],correct:0,explanation:'Enigma means a person or thing that is mysterious or difficult to understand, so synonym is Mystery.'}]}]},'arithmetic':{title:'Arithmetic',topics:[{id:16,topic:'Percentage',questions:[{id:76,question:'What is 25% of 80?',options:['15','20','25','30'],correct:1,explanation:'25% of 80 = (25/100) × 80 = 20'},{id:77,question:'If the price of a product increases from ₹200 to ₹250, what is the percentage increase?',options:['20%','25%','30%','35%'],correct:1,explanation:'Increase = ₹50, Percentage increase = (50/200) × 100 = 25%'},{id:78,question:'A student scores 420 out of 500. What is the percentage score?',options:['82%','84%','86%','88%'],correct:1,explanation:'Percentage = (420/500) × 100 = 84%'},{id:79,question:'If 30% of a number is 45, what is the number?',options:['120','135','150','165'],correct:2,explanation:'Let the number be x, then (30/100)x = 45, so x = 45 × 100/30 = 150'},{id:80,question:'The population of a town increases by 5% annually. If the current population is 20,000, what will be the population after 2 years?',options:['22,000','22,050','22,500','23,000'],correct:1,explanation:'Population after 2 years = 20,000 × (1 + 5/100)² = 20,000 × 1.1025 = 22,050'}]},{id:17,topic:'Ratio and Proportion',questions:[{id:81,question:'If A:B = 3:4 and B:C = 5:6, then A:C is?',options:['5:8','5:6','3:6','3:8'],correct:0,explanation:'A:B = 3:4, B:C = 5:6, so A:C = (3×5):(4×6) = 15:24 = 5:8'},{id:82,question:'Divide ₹600 in the ratio 3:2.',options:['₹360, ₹240','₹300, ₹300','₹400, ₹200','₹350, ₹250'],correct:0,explanation:'Sum of ratio parts = 3+2=5, First part = (3/5)×600=360, Second part = (2/5)×600=240'},{id:83,question:'If 15:20::18:x, then x = ?',options:['20','22','24','26'],correct:2,explanation:'15/20 = 18/x ⇒ 15x = 360 ⇒ x = 360/15 = 24'},{id:84,question:'The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 4:5. If there are 27 students, how many are girls?',options:['12','15','18','20'],correct:1,explanation:'Total parts = 4+5=9, Number of girls = (5/9)×27 = 15'},{id:85,question:'If a:b = 2:3 and b:c = 4:5, then a:b:c = ?',options:['2:3:5','8:12:15','6:9:10','4:6:9'],correct:1,explanation:'a:b = 2:3 = 8:12, b:c = 4:5 = 12:15, so a:b:c = 8:12:15'}]},{id:18,topic:'Time and Work',questions:[{id:86,question:'A can complete a work in 10 days. B can complete it in 15 days. In how many days can they complete it together?',options:['5 days','6 days','8 days','10 days'],correct:1,explanation:'A\'s 1 day work = 1/10, B\'s 1 day work = 1/15, Together = 1/10+1/15 = 5/30 = 1/6, so 6 days'},{id:87,question:'If 6 men can complete a work in 8 days, how many men are needed to complete it in 4 days?',options:['10 men','12 men','14 men','16 men'],correct:1,explanation:'Men × Days = constant, so 6×8 = x×4 ⇒ x = 48/4 = 12 men'},{id:88,question:'A and B together can do a work in 12 days. A alone can do it in 20 days. In how many days can B alone do it?',options:['25 days','30 days','35 days','40 days'],correct:1,explanation:'B\'s 1 day work = 1/12 - 1/20 = 5/60 - 3/60 = 2/60 = 1/30, so 30 days'},{id:89,question:'If 15 workers can build a wall in 24 days, how many days will 18 workers take?',options:['18 days','20 days','22 days','24 days'],correct:1,explanation:'Workers × Days = constant, so 15×24 = 18×x ⇒ x = 360/18 = 20 days'},{id:90,question:'A is twice as efficient as B. If B alone can do a work in 18 days, how long will they take to complete it together?',options:['4 days','5 days','6 days','7 days'],correct:2,explanation:'B\'s efficiency = 1/18, A\'s efficiency = 2/18 = 1/9, Together = 1/9+1/18 = 3/18 = 1/6, so 6 days'}]},{id:19,topic:'Simple Interest',questions:[{id:91,question:'Find the simple interest on ₹2000 at 5% per annum for 3 years.',options:['₹300','₹350','₹400','₹450'],correct:0,explanation:'SI = P×R×T/100 = 2000×5×3/100 = ₹300'},{id:92,question:'At what rate percent per annum will ₹5000 amount to ₹6000 in 4 years?',options:['4%','5%','6%','7%'],correct:1,explanation:'SI = 6000-5000=1000, R = (100×SI)/(P×T) = (100×1000)/(5000×4) = 5%'},{id:93,question:'In how many years will ₹3000 amount to ₹3600 at 5% per annum?',options:['3 years','4 years','5 years','6 years'],correct:1,explanation:'SI = 3600-3000=600, T = (100×SI)/(P×R) = (100×600)/(3000×5) = 4 years'},{id:94,question:'What sum will amount to ₹1500 at 4% per annum in 5 years?',options:['₹1200','₹1250','₹1300','₹1350'],correct:1,explanation:'A = P + SI = P + (P×R×T/100) = P(1+RT/100), 1500 = P(1+20/100)=P(6/5), P=1500×5/6=1250'},{id:95,question:'The simple interest on a sum for 5 years is 2/5 of the sum. The rate percent is?',options:['6%','8%','10%','12%'],correct:1,explanation:'            SI = (2/5)P, R = (100×SI)/(P×T) = (100×(2/5)P)/(P×5) = (40)/5 = 8%'}]},{id:20,topic:'Profit and Loss',questions:[{id:96,question:'A man buys a toy for ₹100 and sells it for ₹120. His gain percent is?',options:['10%','15%','20%','25%'],correct:2,explanation:'Profit = 120-100=20, Profit% = (20/100)×100 = 20%'},{id:97,question:'If the cost price of 10 articles is equal to the selling price of 8 articles, find the gain percent.',options:['20%','25%','30%','35%'],correct:1,explanation:'CP of 10 = SP of 8, Let CP of 1 article = ₹1, CP of 10 = ₹10, SP of 8 = ₹10, SP of 1 = 10/8=1.25, Profit% = (0.25/1)×100 = 25%'},{id:98,question:'A shopkeeper sells an article at a loss of 10%. Had he sold it for ₹90 more, he would have gained 10%. The cost price of the article is?',options:['₹400','₹450','₹500','₹550'],correct:1,explanation:'Let CP = x, SP at 10% loss = 0.9x, SP at 10% gain = 1.1x, Difference = 1.1x - 0.9x = 0.2x = 90, x = 90/0.2 = ₹450'},{id:99,question:'By selling a book for ₹270, a bookseller loses 10%. To gain 10%, he should sell it for?',options:['₹300','₹320','₹330','₹350'],correct:2,explanation:'SP = ₹270 (90% of CP), CP = 270×100/90 = ₹300, To gain 10%, SP = 110% of 300 = ₹330'},{id:100,question:'A man sells two chairs for ₹240 each. On one he gains 20% and on the other he loses 20%. His net gain or loss is?',options:['1% gain','1% loss','4% gain','4% loss'],correct:3,explanation:'CP of first chair = 240/1.2 = ₹200, CP of second chair = 240/0.8 = ₹300, Total CP = ₹500, Total SP = ₹480, Loss% = (20/500)×100 = 4%'}]}]},'mental-ability':{title:'Mental Ability',topics:[{id:21,topic:'Series Completion',questions:[{id:101,question:'Complete the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?',options:['40','42','44','46'],correct:1,explanation:'Pattern: 1×2=2, 2×3=6, 3×4=12, 4×5=20, 5×6=30, 6×7=42'},{id:102,question:'Find the next term: A, C, F, J, ?',options:['N','O','P','Q'],correct:1,explanation:'Pattern: A(+2)=C, C(+3)=F, F(+4)=J, J(+5)=O'},{id:103,question:'Complete the series: 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, ?',options:['36','49','64','81'],correct:0,explanation:'Pattern: 1²=1, 2²=4, 3²=9, 4²=16, 5²=25, 6²=36'},{id:104,question:'Find the missing number: 3, 7, 15, 31, 63, ?',options:['127','128','129','130'],correct:0,explanation:'Pattern: 3×2+1=7, 7×2+1=15, 15×2+1=31, 31×2+1=63, 63×2+1=127'},{id:105,question:'Complete the series: Z, X, V, T, R, ?',options:['P','O','N','M'],correct:0,explanation:'Pattern: Z(-2)=X, X(-2)=V, V(-2)=T, T(-2)=R, R(-2)=P'}]},{id:22,topic:'Coding-Decoding',questions:[{id:106,question:'If "CODE" is written as "DPEF", how is "WORD" written?',options:['XPSE','XPSF','XQSE','XQSF'],correct:0,explanation:'C+1=D, O+1=P, D+1=E, E+1=F; Similarly W+1=X, O+1=P, R+1=S, D+1=E → XPSE'},{id:107,question:'If "Tiger" is coded as "Regit", how is "Lion" coded?',options:['Noil','Niol','Loim','Loin'],correct:1,explanation:'Reverse coding: Tiger → Regit, Lion → Niol'},{id:108,question:'In a code language, "APPLE" is written as "BQQMF". How is "MANGO" written?',options:['NBOHP','NBOIP','NCOHP','NCOIP'],correct:0,explanation:'Each letter moves one forward: A→B, P→Q, P→Q, L→M, E→F; Similarly M→N, A→B, N→O, G→H, O→P → NBOHP'},{id:109,question:'If "RED" is coded as "6723", how is "GREEN" coded?',options:['796623','797623','796723','797723'],correct:1,explanation:'R=18→1+8=9-2=7, E=5→5-2=3, D=4→4-2=2; Similarly G=7→7-2=5, R=18→1+8=9-2=7, E=5→5-2=3, E=5→5-2=3, N=14→1+4=5-2=3 → 797623'},{id:110,question:'If "WORK" is coded as "4-12-9-16", how is "JOB" coded?',options:['8-12-2','10-15-2','10-12-2','8-15-2'],correct:1,explanation:'W=23→2+3=5, O=15→1+5=6, R=18→1+8=9, K=11→1+1=2; Pattern: Position number reduced to single digit; J=10→1+0=1, O=15→1+5=6, B=2→2 → 10-15-2'}]},{id:23,topic:'Direction Sense',questions:[{id:111,question:'A man is facing north. He turns 90° in the clockwise direction and then 135° in the anti-clockwise direction. Which direction is he facing now?',options:['North-East','North-West','South-East','South-West'],correct:0,explanation:'North → 90° clockwise = East → 135° anti-clockwise = East to North-East'},{id:112,question:'Rahul walks 10km towards south, then turns right and walks 5km, then turns right again and walks 10km. In which direction is he from the starting point?',options:['North','South','East','West'],correct:2,explanation:'The path forms a rectangle. He is 5km east of starting point.'},{id:113,question:'If South-East becomes North, then what will West become?',options:['South-East','North-East','South-West','North-West'],correct:1,explanation:'When South-East becomes North, the directions rotate 135° clockwise, so West becomes North-East.'},{id:114,question:'A person starts from point A and walks 3km east to B, then turns left and walks 4km to C. How far is he from the starting point?',options:['5km','6km','7km','8km'],correct:0,explanation:'Using Pythagoras theorem: √(3²+4²) = √(9+16) = √25 = 5km'},{id:115,question:'Mohan faces north. Turning to his right, he walks 25m. He then turns to his left and walks 30m. Next, he moves 25m to his right. Finally, he turns to his right again and walks 55m. In which direction is he now from his starting point?',options:['North','South','East','West'],correct:1,explanation:'After all movements, he is south of starting point.'}]},{id:24,topic:'Blood Relations',questions:[{id:116,question:'Pointing to a woman, a man said, "Her brother\'s father is my father\'s only son." How is the woman related to the man?',options:['Sister','Daughter','Mother','Niece'],correct:1,explanation:'"My father\'s only son" is the man himself. So "her brother\'s father is me" means I am her father. So she is my daughter.'},{id:117,question:'A and B are brothers. C and D are sisters. A\'s son is D\'s brother. How is B related to C?',options:['Father','Brother','Uncle','Grandfather'],correct:2,explanation:'A\'s son is D\'s brother, so A is father of C and D. B is A\'s brother, so B is uncle of C.'},{id:118,question:'Pointing to a photograph, a man said, "I have no brother or sister but that man\'s father is my father\'s son." Who is in the photograph?',options:['His son','His father','Himself','His nephew'],correct:0,explanation:'"My father\'s son" is the man himself (since he has no brothers). So "that man\'s father is me" means the photograph is of his son.'},{id:119,question:'If A is B\'s sister, C is B\'s mother, D is C\'s father, E is D\'s mother, then how is A related to D?',options:['Granddaughter','Daughter','Mother','Sister'],correct:0,explanation:'A is B\'s sister, C is mother of both A and B, D is C\'s father, so D is grandfather of A. Thus A is granddaughter of D.'},{id:120,question:'Introducing a boy, a girl said, "He is the son of the daughter of the father of my uncle." How is the boy related to the girl?',options:['Brother','Son','Uncle','Nephew'],correct:0,explanation:'"Father of my uncle" is my grandfather. "Daughter of my grandfather" is my aunt/mother. "Son of my aunt/mother" is my brother/cousin. Most likely brother.'}]},{id:25,topic:'Logical Reasoning',questions:[{id:121,question:'If all cats are animals, and some animals are pets, which statement must be true?',options:['All cats are pets','Some cats are pets','No cats are pets','None of these'],correct:3,explanation:'We cannot conclude that some cats are pets because the "some animals" that are pets might not include any cats.'},{id:122,question:'No pencils are pens. Some pens are markers. Which conclusion follows?',options:['Some pencils are markers','No pencils are markers','Some markers are not pencils','None of these'],correct:2,explanation:'Since no pencils are pens and some pens are markers, it follows that some markers are not pencils.'},{id:123,question:'If Monday is the first day of the week, what will be the day after the 5th day?',options:['Friday','Saturday','Sunday','Monday'],correct:1,explanation:'1st=Monday, 2nd=Tuesday, 3rd=Wednesday, 4th=Thursday, 5th=Friday, Day after 5th day=Saturday'},{id:124,question:'Statement: All scientists are researchers. Some researchers are professors. Conclusion: Some scientists are professors. This conclusion is:',options:['Definitely true','Probably true','Cannot be determined','Definitely false'],correct:2,explanation:'We cannot determine if some scientists are professors because the researchers who are professors might not include any scientists.'},{id:125,question:'If "P + Q" means P is the brother of Q, "P × Q" means P is the father of Q, and "P ÷ Q" means P is the mother of Q, then what does "A + B × C" mean?',options:['A is brother of C','A is uncle of C','A is father of C','A is brother of B\'s father'],correct:1,explanation:'B × C means B is father of C. A + B means A is brother of B. So A is brother of B (father of C), meaning A is uncle of C.'}]}]},'malayalam':{title:'Malayalam',topics:[{id:26,topic:'വ്യാകരണം',questions:[{id:126,question:'"അമ്മ" എന്ന പദത്തിന്റെ ബഹുവചന രൂപം ഏത്?',options:['അമ്മമാർ','അമ്മകൾ','അമ്മാമാർ','അമ്മാക്കൾ'],correct:1,explanation:'"അമ്മ" എന്ന പദത്തിന്റെ ബഹുവചന രൂപം "അമ്മമാർ" ആണ്.'},{id:127,question:'ഏത് പദമാണ് സമാസ പദം അല്ലാത്തത്?',options:['വീട്ടുകാരൻ','പഠിപ്പിക്കുക','നല്ലവൻ','തലക്കെട്ട്'],correct:1,explanation:'"പഠിപ്പിക്കുക" ഒരു ധാതുജ പദമാണ്, സമാസ പദമല്ല.'},{id:128,question:'"അവൻ പഠിക്കുന്നു" എന്ന വാക്യത്തിലെ "പഠിക്കുന്നു" ഏത് ക്രിയാരൂപമാണ്?',options:['ഭൂതകാലം','വർത്തമാനകാലം','ഭാവികാലം','സാധാരണഭൂതം'],correct:1,explanation:'"പഠിക്കുന്നു" എന്നത് വർത്തമാനകാല ക്രിയാരൂപമാണ്.'},{id:129,question:'ഏതാണ് സരള വാക്യം?',options:['അവൻ വന്നപ്പോൾ ഞാൻ പോയി.','അവൻ വന്നു, ഞാൻ പോയി.','അവൻ വന്നുകൊണ്ടിരിക്കെ ഞാൻ പോയി.','അവൻ വന്നതിന് ശേഷം ഞാൻ പോയി.'],correct:1,explanation:'"അവൻ വന്നു, ഞാൻ പോയി." എന്നതാണ് സരള വാക്യം (Compound sentence).'},{id:130,question:'"സഹോദരി" എന്ന പദത്തിന് സമാനാർഥകമല്ലാത്ത പദം ഏത്?',options:['സഗർഭ','സഹജ','സാനിധ്യ','സഹജാത'],correct:2,explanation:'"സാനിധ്യ" എന്നാൽ സമീപം എന്നാണ് അർഥം, സഹോദരിയുമായി ബന്ധമില്ല.'}]},{id:27,topic:'സാഹിത്യം',questions:[{id:131,question:'ജ്ഞാനപീഠ പുരസ്കാരം ലഭിച്ച ആദ്യ മലയാളി ആര്?',options:['ജി. ശങ്കരക്കുറുപ്പ്','എസ്. കെ. പൊറ്റേക്കാട്','തകഴി ശിവശങ്കരപ്പിള്ള','എം.ടി. വാസുദേവൻ നായർ'],correct:0,explanation:'ജി. ശങ്കരക്കുറുപ്പിനാണ് 1965-ൽ ജ്ഞാനപീഠ പുരസ്കാരം ലഭിച്ചത്.'},{id:132,question:'"ഓടക്കുഴൽ" എന്ന കൃതിയുടെ കർത്താവ് ആര്?',options:['വൈലോപ്പിള്ളി','കുമാരനാശാൻ','ഉള്ളൂർ','വള്ളത്തോൾ'],correct:1,explanation:'"ഓടക്കുഴൽ" എന്ന കാവ്യകൃതി കുമാരനാശാന്റെ രചനയാണ്.'},{id:133,question:'ഏത് നോവലിലാണ് "വേലുപ്പിള്ള" എന്ന കഥാപാത്രം?',options:['ചേരമാൻ','ഇന്ദുലേഖ','മാധവിക്കുട്ടി','അരയങ്കമ്മ'],correct:1,explanation:'ഓ. ചന്തുമേനോന്റെ "ഇന്ദുലേഖ" യിലാണ് "വേലുപ്പിള്ള" എന്ന കഥാപാത്രം.'},{id:134,question:'"പാത്തുമ്മയുടെ ആട്" എന്ന കഥയുടെ കർത്താവ് ആര്?',options:['വൈക്കം മുഹമ്മദ് ബഷീർ','ടി. കെ. സീതാലക്ഷ്മി','കെ. പി. കേസവദേവ്','ബഷീർ'],correct:0,explanation:'"പാത്തുമ്മയുടെ ആട്" വൈക്കം മുഹമ്മദ് ബഷീറിന്റെ കഥയാണ്.'},{id:135,question:'ഏത് കവിയാണ് "മഹാകവി" എന്നറിയപ്പെടുന്നത്?',options:['കുഞ്ചൻ നമ്പ്യാർ','കുമാരനാശാൻ','വള്ളത്തോൾ','ഉള്ളൂർ'],correct:2,explanation:'വള്ളത്തോൾ നാരായണ മേനോനാണ് "മഹാകവി" എന്നറിയപ്പെടുന്നത്.'}]},{id:28,topic:'ചരിത്രം',questions:[{id:136,question:'കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ ഭരണഘടനാ സമിതി അധ്യക്ഷൻ ആരായിരുന്നു?',options:['പത്മനാഭപുരം','എ. കെ. ഗോപാലൻ','സി. കേശവൻ','കെ. കേളപ്പൻ'],correct:0,explanation:'പത്മനാഭപുരം ആണ് കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ ഭരണഘടനാ സമിതി അധ്യക്ഷൻ.'},{id:137,question:'വേണാടിന്റെ അവസാന രാജാവ് ആരായിരുന്നു?',options:['ധർമ്മരാജ','രാമവർമ','ഭദ്രാദ്രിവർമ','ശ്രീമൂലം തിരുനാൾ'],correct:1,explanation:'രാമവർമ ആണ് വേണാടിന്റെ അവസാന രാജാവ്.'},{id:138,question:'കേരളത്തിൽ ആദ്യമായി ഇംഗ്ലീഷ് മീഡിയം സ്കൂൾ സ്ഥാപിച്ചത് ആര്?',options:['ബഞ്ചമിൻ ബെയ്ലി','ഹെർമൻ ഗുണ്ടർട്ട്','കർണ്ണൽ മൺറോ','വില്യം കാരി'],correct:2,explanation:'കർണ്ണൽ മൺറോ ആണ് കേരളത്തിൽ ആദ്യമായി ഇംഗ്ലീഷ് മീഡിയം സ്കൂൾ സ്ഥാപിച്ചത്.'},{id:139,question:'"മലബാർ ലഹള" നടന്ന വർഷം ഏത്?',options:['1921','1946','1896','1857'],correct:0,explanation:'മലബാർ ലഹള (മപ്പിള ലഹള) 1921-ൽ നടന്നു.'},{id:140,question:'തിരുവിതാംകൂറിലെ "ആദ്യ മന്ത്രിസഭ" രൂപീകരിച്ചത് ഏത് വർഷം?',options:['1948','1956','1937','1947'],correct:0,explanation:'തിരുവിതാംകൂറിലെ ആദ്യ മന്ത്രിസഭ 1948-ൽ രൂപീകരിച്ചു.'}]},{id:29,topic:'സംസ്കൃതി',questions:[{id:141,question:'കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ "ചലച്ചിത്രം" ഏതാണ്?',options:['വിഗതകുമാരൻ','മാരത്തോണ്ട','ബാലൻ','ജീവിതനൗക'],correct:0,explanation:'"വിഗതകുമാരൻ" (1928) ആണ് കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ ചലച്ചിത്രം.'},{id:142,question:'കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ "പൂർണ്ണ ചലച്ചിത്രം" ഏതാണ്?',options:['വിഗതകുമാരൻ','ബാലൻ','മാരത്തോണ്ട','ജീവിതനൗക'],correct:1,explanation:'"ബാലൻ" (1938) ആണ് കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ പൂർണ്ണ ചലച്ചിത്രം.'},{id:143,question:'കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ "സംഗീത നാടക അക്കാദമി" സ്ഥാപിച്ചത് എവിടെ?',options:['തൃശൂർ','കൊച്ചി','തിരുവനന്തപുരം','കോഴിക്കോട്'],correct:0,explanation:'കേരളത്തിലെ ആദ്യത്തെ സംഗീത നാടക അക്കാദമി തൃശൂരിൽ സ്ഥാപിച്ചു.'},{id:144,question:'"മോഹിനിയാട്ടം" എന്ന നൃത്തം ഏത് ജില്ലയുമായി ബന്ധപ്പെട്ടതാണ്?',options:['കൊല്ലം','തിരുവനന്തപുരം','പാലക്കാട്','ആലപ്പുഴ'],correct:1,explanation:'മോഹിനിയാട്ടം തിരുവനന്തപുരം ജില്ലയുമായി ബന്ധപ്പെട്ടതാണ്.'},{id:145,question:'കേരളത്തിലെ
